author: Richard Groves
comment: I've gone between several weather apps over the years but I'm happiest with Weather Timeline. Great widgets too, which is where a lot of competitors fail.   That said, where's my favourite Easter egg gone when searching for a date in the future (via a calendar)?? I'm sad if it's been removed.

author: Kurt B
comment: Works pretty good but widget no longer will update on my home screen, even when tapping on the refresh button.  I have to open the app and only THEN will the widget update.  This is on my Samsung Galaxy Note 8 running stock Android 7.1.1.  Still works fine on my Note 4 running Android 6.0.1.  Contacted developer weeks ago about the issue and problem hasn't been fixed.  Uninstalling and going to paid version of Weather UG.  WOW, I posted the above review 11.28.17 and ZERO response from the developer and no update to fix the issue.

author: Lamberto Fichera
comment: This app used to work great and was one of my favorite weather apps ever. Since today, it crashes immediately after opening on my OnePlus 5 (Android O). Please fix it and I'll give back 5 stars

author: Sasha.M
comment: First of all, developer ignore his clients, doesn't respond EVER, even if we paid for the app. Widgets could be prettier, with clock and all info. You need to add more weather providers. Advance UI, it looks outdated. And we paid for time machine and now it's gone, really?

author: Johan Augustin Wågan Baustad
comment: Like the app but it's bad that the icon options don't contain icons for every weather they predict, leaving iconless "holes" for some weather types. Also should be updated with more icon sets.

author: George Vermeulen
comment: I spent years looking for the perfect weather app, and had given up until I stumbled across Timeline. A gorgeous app with an exemplary implementation of Material Design from one of the friendliest and most approachable devs on the scene today. I can't endorse this app enough. Absolutely perfect.

author: Seth Pierce
comment: Edit: switched the weather source from dark sky to weather underground. Much more dependable. Love the layout. Radar maps are pretty useful. The problem is that the forecast is almost always wrong. Temps vary by several degrees from other apps, and those other apps are always more accurate.

author: nelov I
comment: Great design with terific options and possibilities! However I'm not able to turn off weather alerts for "Extreme cold" when it's not that cold at all  - at just around 0 degrees Celsius. It's getting quite annoying and I don't want to turn off all alarms!

author: TJ Walker
comment: In general, I like this application very much; solid design and functionality. As of late, though, there seems to be a bug by which the location addition mechanism (the circular green plus button in the bottom right-hand corner) has disappeared. As a result, it's not full functional, 🏧.

author: Guus van bolderen
comment: Amazing app, perfect in terms of the material guidelines. However one of the features (that is more a gimmick than anything else) got killed off, this was time machine. I would love to see this coming back

author: Vance Nguyen
comment: Doesn't show the real High/Low for some reason. If you click the hourly forecast, you will see different highs/lows throughout the day.  Waste of money.

author: Vulgrim Merchant
comment: UPDATE! The developer added the degrees symbol back which fixed my one-and-only gripe. Amazing app with great aesthetic. BACK TO 5 STARS!  (original) The only frustrating thing is you can't change the font of the temperature numbers in the notification/status bar. That ability would make the app a 10/10. Also for some reason the latest update took away the little degrees symbol and made the font in the notification/status bar even larger? Font customization would be a dream come true.

author: Josh Darnell
comment: Perfect weather app!!!  Nothing more to say about it.  Buy it now. EDIT* Time machine function was taken away. Should not be allowed to remove features once paid for. That was my main use of this app.... Now it's no different than any other app.

author: Jeff Frederick
comment: Good app, but it lacks a precipitation radar map that differenciates between rain and snow.  It only shows the intensity rang of the precipitation, not the type.  For this reason I have to go back my WeatherBug app.

author: T Duong
comment: Old version was much better. The umbrella alert actually gave me a picture of an umbrella, making sure to notice me that it was going to rain. This version got rid of the umbrella and just has a regular weather notification.  Also. It's been basically a year and they still have issues with adding locations.

author: Jed Parker
comment: This app is everything I want in a weather app and more. I love everything about it. The widgets, the material design, the fluidity. All amazing. Keep up the great work. Only issue I've experienced was that the map is a little glitchy and doesn't seem to work right, but I never use that anyway.

author: The Doc
comment: Looks great, and was very accurate, at first. But it couldn't tell it was snowing, just said "light rain" so now I kind of struggle to believe anything it tells me.

author: Kristian Santiago
comment: Pretty nice, except for the fact that sometimes certain days on my weekly widget disappear so I'll have for example: Today, Saturday and Monday showing. Why is my Sunday missing? Hope it can be fixed. Otherwise easily the nicest looking app/widget out there.

author: Rahim Othman
comment: I bought this app for the "Time Machine" feature just to realize shortly after that it was removed. This is a big disappointment given the fact it was the main motive for me to purchase it!

author: Jonathan Bressler
comment: Great app and I especially love the persistent notification. Only 3 stars for now because the ability to hide the persistent notification in the status bar is broken. It keeps popping up after a few minutes and it never used to.

author: Robert Roper
comment: Great app. I like the widgets, especially the "Stack" so I can flip through cities right on the homepage. Be sure to add cities to the app before using the stack widget, though, or else the widget will be invisible -- I got confused by that and left a negative review earlier today, but I figured it out and it's a 5-star app in my opinion!

author: Siwel Anyer
comment: In the hourly timeline contradicting information appears. Under the Time header "Light Rain" may appear, but right next to it "No Rain" under Temp header. Got no response from developer.

All I need from weather APP is to push a notification to me every morning if it's going to rain today, that's it, I don't know why it's so difficult for virtually every other weather Apps to understand that except for this one. Still, would much appreciated if the forecast can be more accurate.

So I just moved to a big city and I need to know the weather on specific places of it, this does the trick and it looks awesome without giving too much on design and compromising functionality. Certainly worth the money and for this much everyone should buy it

author: Sharon Pierson
comment: The widget stopped showing local weather on the home sceen of my tablet. When configuring, it shows the data, but after clicking Add to Home Screen, the widget shows on default template data, such as "city" instead of a city.

author: Peter Chang
comment: It's pretty but it loses connecting and failed tip refresh very easily and frankly way too often. Every time I open the app it couldn't load the weather data until I have refresh it multiple times. Same issue on WiFi and data.

author: Daniel Harborne
comment: The best weather app hands down! I have been looking for an app that would provide me a quick glimpse of the weather for the next few hours, and this app did it, in the notifications panel. Genius!  I'm using this app as my Android Wear watch face too. The Android Wear app could improve, especially if we could have more control over the background and text colours. (I need light grey text).

author: Sebastian H
comment: I believe that this weather app is increidble, by far the best in the store, and it's the Nova Launcher of weather apps (unimaginably customizable and beautiful UI at the same time). With this amazingly developed app, I only have have two minor comments: 1) it'd be nice to have a refresh button and/or last updated time on the ongoing notification so that I'm reassured I'm not looking at an outdated temperature (compare to WUnderground app) 2) The "show temperature as line graph" option should show the temperature progression through each day, not in steps to the high and low temps only (compare to Wunderground app). However this app is absolutely stellar and I greatly enjoy using it as my daily driver. Keep up the great work!

author: Jennifer McGaffey
comment: Very good app - its numbers match my own sensors (thermometer etc) better than any other I've tried. I like the style, too. However 1) I very much liked Time Machine, hope it comes back - not really accurate, of course, but great for a general idea and 2) I really want a 1x1 widget that shows highs and lows. The smallest way to get that data on the home screen now is Small Week, 1x4 - too big.

author: Julie B.
comment: It's a beautiful app, but they took away the time machine feature!? That was the whole reason I had it.

author: Justin Davison
comment: Took away time machine feature without notice. Annoying, since it is a paid app and that was a main reason for purchasing.

author: Jordan
comment: Great app that utilizes material design perfectly. Only gripe is  as of late the notification icon shows in status bar even when the hide notification option is selected.

author: Michael Smyer
comment: Use to be my favorite weather application, but the forecast on all the providers have been incorrect for the last year. I had to start using AccuWeather again.

author: James
comment: Biggest complaint is I can't hide the status bar icon now if I want the notification forcast.

author: David Scott Stokes
comment: Good app and would be great if it could show the wind direction with little arrows like Pocket Weather. Bicycle riders like to know about head winds and tail winds.

author: Azhar Pratama
comment: Beautiful and well-thought-out weather app, also with a great widget! DashClock integration could be better though since I'm using Chronus as my main widget.

author: Ryan McNeil
comment: By far the best weather app on Android. Always among the first apps I install, and has the best widget, period. Nothing short of perfect.

author: Dmitrij Paškevič
comment: Best and loveliest weather app. No nonsense UI and full of features.  UPDATE On 8.1 app ignores the "don not show in status bar" option toggle and persistently shows an icon in the status bar.

author: Nathan B
comment: Design changes rather than options means to please one set of users, the developer must disappoint the rest.

author: Gabriel Mesaros
comment: UPDATE: 12/28/17 I compare the temperature reading of this app with two other apps for the same location, and the readings were way off. This app was showing 3°, and the other two 12°. Which one is it? I mean that is 9° jump. For some people something like that matters greatly.
